review_title: It's a great place to work
pros: Plenty of room to grow and advance
cons: Odd schedules that are unpredictable at times

pros: Great staff, retirement benefits, good place to learn and grow
cons: Management can be disorganized, short staffed and overworked at times.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Odessa, TX
pros: - Good benefits and decent base pay for area ($32/hr) - Supportive/friendly staff in all areas that are willing to help you
cons: - Intentionally short staff units to save money - You feel as though you do the job of 4-5 people due to lack of staff - Small raises ($0.20/year) - No incentive for staff to stay

pros: a great learning opportunity before becoming a new Grad
cons: The nurses can be rude -ICU

pros:
Very good work/life balance 
Great people to work with 
You gain a variety of experience from pediatric to geriatric.
cons:
Not much growth in the position.
Very fast paced and demanding. 
Always shorthanded due to management.

pros: Retirement is cool. Actual staff, eg ppl who treat patients, are super sweet.
cons: Admin is as trash as the city we serve. Chauvinism is rampant.

pros: People are friendly. That’s pretty much it.
cons: Archaic methodology and asinine procedures.

pros: great people overall work here. Everyone is helpful.
cons: short staffed. You will be tripled in a specialty unit. And full time here is 84 hrs a pay period

job_title: Critical Care Nursing in Odessa, TX
pros: Your fellow co-workers. These are the people who you "go to war with" every day. Many pros that I would have mentioned have been discontinued in the past year.
cons: Severely under staffed. Completely under appreciated by management and administration. They have taken away many benefits that employees felt worthwhile to stay in west Texas for. They talk about cutting costs but are building clinics around town like they are Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks. Voted in closed session to discontinue retirees benefit to paid insurance leaving former employees scrambling to find insurance. They have NO regard for current, past or future employees.

review_title: A great hospital with some work to do
pros: Lots of long time employees dedicated to the success of the hospital.
cons: Due to the area being a boom and bust economy related to the oilfield, every hospital is short staffed. You make better money by leaving and returning than you do if you stay in one place.

pros: nice bosses, normal 8-5 M-F, benefits work well for single workers or those with a full family however the services must be done at mch for full benefit
cons: some policies are old and outdated, and the higher ups really dont give proper appreciation to the workers

review_title: Overall I thought it was a poor hospital and I was very dissatified with how they treat there emploees.
pros: They are a fairly little hospital and able to treat patients quickly. They have a med- chopper that can take you to the nearest or better hospital available 24/7.
cons: I dont believe they take care of there employees very well. They are quick to fire and replace you and do not listen to your constructive critism.

review_title: I have been working in this hospital for over 20 years.
pros: Benefits are very good.
cons: Middle management is very poor. There is no value placed on experience and knowledge. Supervisors are making decisions that are detrimental to quality of work as well as quality of health care. Very poor morale.

pros: Very knowledgable staff, always available & easy to get along with.  The docs are always willing to explain what they are doing & why.
cons: A lot of them are still residents, but that's part of it and I do not mind teaching & answering questions.

pros: The staff work as a team and are willing to help and educate you. The nursing education department is knowledgable and helps advance your knowledge by offering certification programs.
cons: Under staffed and over worked. Nurses don't have enough help and are always carrying six patients. Charge nurses sometimes carry a patient load of 4-5 patients.

review_title: Was a good place to work,
job_title: Hot Food Cook in Odessa, TX
pros: Has a nice retirement program, has good medical benefits, has good parking for employees, the management is easy to work with if you have issues.
cons: The HR office is off in another building on the other side of the campus which can be hard to get to if you need to go there while working

job_title: Environmental Services Supervisor in Odessa, TX
pros:
Two 30 minute breaks.
Shift differentials can add anywhere from $2 to$3 to your hourly pay.
Working weekends adds another $2 to $3 on top of that.
You can charge items like lunch in the cafeteria to your badge and it is deducted from your next pay check.
cons: This department has low pay for its workers. The lowest paid department in the hospital.

review_title: Great place to work! Fun and friendly environment!
pros: There is tuition reimbursement, many chances for higher opportunities, and a fun and friendly work environment.
cons: Fast paced, some staff were resistant to change.

pros: They continue to grow and improve in our community
cons: Too focused on top status , for hospital, not enough on Client - nurse ratio..  To give better patient care.

review_title: Amazing place to work!  Great people; great pay!!
job_title: Assistant LIS Coordinator in Odessa, TX
pros: Great benefits and perks!  Everyone works well as a team!!
cons: I can't think of any cons...

pros: Lots of hours, lots of experience, great people, new lifetime friends
cons: Long hours are not good if you have a family.

pros: Core values, benefits, co workers
cons: Ignore our department, no chance for advancement from the pbx dept

pros: great community and friendly people
cons: understaffed so nurses take on too many patients

pros: Great experience, staff is friendly
cons: Low pay, people in charge don’t know how to run hospital, don’t value employees

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Odessa, TX
pros: Tuition reimbursement is offered, sign on bonus
cons: High turnover rate, no incentives for higher education, no career ladder, etc.
